name: Basic Assault Combo
description: A fundamental three-strike combination: two horizontal slashes followed by a finishing thrust. The rhythm and momentum of the sequence grants bonuses to speed and efficiency.

sequence.name: Opening Slash
sequence.description: First slash - no bonuses, establishes the combo rhythm

bonuses.description: Second slash flows from the first - faster wind-up (-200ms) and more efficient (-1 stamina)

windUp.description: Weapon already in motion from first slash

stamina.description: Momentum from first slash reduces effort needed

bonuses.description: Thrust flows naturally from second slash - much faster wind-up (-600ms) and more efficient (-1 stamina)

windUp.description: Transitioning from horizontal slash to forward thrust with built momentum

stamina.description: Combo saves 2 stamina compared to executing skills independently

focus.description: Focus cost calculated from stamina cost

dailyFatigue.description: Daily fatigue calculated from stamina cost

breakdown.note: Overlapping recovery and wind-up phases when executed as combo

totalDuration.description: Combo saves 800ms compared to executing skills with full recovery between each

comboTelegraphs.description: Combos are easier to predict than individual skills. After first slash, experienced opponents can anticipate the pattern.

subsequentSkills.description: Each skill in combo sequence is 20% easier to predict due to established pattern

counterplay.description: Defender can prepare defense earlier once combo pattern is recognized

advantages: Significant stamina savings (2 stamina over 3 attacks)
Maintains offensive pressure through continuous attacks
Efficient resource usage for sustained aggression
disadvantages: Highly predictable - experienced opponents will read the pattern
Commits to three attacks - difficult to cancel mid-combo
Defender gains more time to prepare once pattern recognized
Repetition makes telegraphs easier to read
bestUsedWhen: Opponent is low on stamina and can't afford multiple defenses
Overwhelming defensive opponent with sustained pressure
Need to maximize damage while conserving stamina
Opponent hasn't seen your combo pattern yet
avoidWhen: Opponent has shown they can read combo patterns
You've used this combo multiple times already
Opponent is waiting for predictable attack
You need flexibility to adapt mid-sequence

canBreakCombo.description: Can break combo by feinting any skill in sequence, or if hit during combo. Cannot switch to defense mid-combo.

metadata.notes: Foundation combo for learning combo mechanics. Efficient but predictable. Use sparingly and mix with other attacks to avoid being read. Most effective as a finisher when opponent is already pressured.
